news.title: France to intercept small boats after pressure from UK
news.summary: The change in policy comes after Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer wrote to President Emmanuel Macron.

news.title: Parents threatened and blamed by authorities as 1,000 adopted children returned to care
news.summary: Families seeking help for their childrenâ€™s complex needs describe threats of police action against them.

news.title: Hong Kong tower blocks fire death toll rises to 128
news.summary: Authorities say 89 bodies are unidentified and 79 people remain injured after Wednesday's blaze.

news.title: Minister defends 'pragmatic' U-turn on unfair dismissal manifesto pledge
news.summary: Bridget Phillipson told the BBC the climbdown would enable wider benefits to be delivered quickly.

news.title: Trump says US will pause migration from 'third-world countries'
news.summary: The president did not name which countries would be affected, but vowed to remove anyone "not a net asset" to the US.

news.title: UK submits 2035 World Cup bid and lists new Old Trafford stadium as venue
news.summary: Manchester United's proposed new Old Trafford stadium is one of 22 venues named in the UK's bid to host the 2035 Women's World Cup.

news.title: We met on TV's Blind Date - we're still married after 34 years
news.summary: Sue and Alex Tatham became the first couple who met on Blind Date to get married. They reflect on a life together 40 years after the show first broadcast.

news.title: Singer Olivia Dean wins refunds for fans after criticising Ticketmaster
news.summary: The pop star took action after tickets for her US tour were resold for 14 times their original cost.

news.title: Search for British man who fell from cruise ship off Tenerife coast
news.summary: The Spanish coastguard has been coordinating search and rescue efforts since Thursday morning.

news.title: Nuns who ran away from care home to Alpine convent can stay - if they stay off social media
news.summary: The three nuns say they were taken out of the convent against their will and placed in a care home.
